member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.DSP.DSPConst.DefaultSampleSize
member.summary: Used by DSP Filters to Set the default Split Size. This is needed when a large Buffer arrives and the Application would't respond until the DSP is done. If the SampleSize of an Filter is Set to Value > 0 then the Buffer will be splitted at this amount of Samples and processed until all Samples are processed. After every Process, Application.ProcessMessages is called to make the Application respond to Windows. DefaultSampleSize is just a default Value. The SampleSize can be changed on every Filter seperate.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.DSP.DSPConverter
member.summary: Static methods to convert between different sample formats.

remarks.para: Code is mainly based on information available on the original C source code pa_converters.c from Portable Audio I/O Library.
This class try to be as fast as possible without using unsafe code.
Dither isn't currently supported. Currently supported conversions are 'to' and 'from' conversions between the following value types:
Integer 8-bit (byte), Integer 16-bit (Int16), Integer 32-bit (Int32), Single precision 32-bit floating point (float).
Which are the most common PCM formats.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.DSP.DynamicAmplify
member.summary: DSP filter to automiticaly keep the volume at a specific maximum Value. If the volume is silent for a specific time, the amplification is raised to a specific Value. If the current amplification would break the range of the audiodata, the amplification is faded out to the maximum possible amplification.

member.summary: Gets amplification value than will be used when amplifying.

member.summary: Sets amplification value than will be used when amplifying.

member.summary: Gets time in milliSeconds that the DSP will wait to continue amplification, after the maximum has been reached.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.DSP.DynamicAmplify.SetReleaseTime(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets time in milliSeconds that the DSP will wait to continue amplification, after the maximum has been reached.

member.summary: Gets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 10000, which means that no amplification occours. A value of 20000 raises the amplification by 2.

member.summary: Sets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 10000, which means that no amplification occours. A value of 20000 raises the amplification by 2.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.DSP.Equalizer.AudioEncoding.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.remarks: Source wmCodec.h

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.DSP.Equalizer.AudioEncoding.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS. See .
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.summary: Reads a sequence of samples from the underlying , applies the equalizer effect and advances the position within the stream by the number of samples read.
member.param: An array of floats. When this method returns, the contains the specified float array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the floats read from the current source.
The zero-based offset in the at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of samples to read from the current source.
member.returns: The total number of samples read into the buffer.

member.summary: Gets or sets the sample rate, in samples per second (hertz).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.DSP.Equalizer.WaveFormat.BytesPerSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets the required average data transfer rate, in bytes per second. For example, 16-bit stereo at 44.1 kHz has an average data rate of 176,400 bytes per second (2 channels — 2 bytes per sample per channel — 44,100 samples per second).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.DSP.Equalizer.WaveFormat.BlockAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data. For PCM data, the block alignment is the number of bytes used by a single sample, including data for both channels if the data is stereo. For example, the block alignment for 16-bit stereo PCM is 4 bytes (2 channels x 2 bytes per sample).

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.DSPConverter
member.summary: Static methods to convert between different sample formats.

remarks.para: Code is mainly based on information available on the original C source code pa_converters.c from Portable Audio I/O Library.
This class try to be as fast as possible without using unsafe code.
Dither isn't currently supported. Currently supported conversions are 'to' and 'from' conversions between the following value types:
Integer 8-bit (byte), Integer 16-bit (Int16), Integer 32-bit (Int32), Single precision 32-bit floating point (float).
Which are the most common PCM formats.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.DynamicAmplifyDSP
member.summary: DSP filter to automiticaly keep the volume at a specific maximum Value. If the volume is silent for a specific time, the amplification is raised to a specific Value. If the current amplification would break the range of the audiodata, the amplification is faded out to the maximum possible amplification.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.DynamicAmplifyDSP.AttackTime
member.summary: Gets or sets amplification value than will be used when amplifying.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.DynamicAmplifyDSP.ReleaseTime
member.summary: Gets or sets time in milliSeconds that the DSP will wait to continue amplification, after the maximum has been reached.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.DynamicAmplifyDSP.MaxAmplification
member.summary: Gets or sets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 10000, which means that no amplification occours. A value of 20000 raises the amplification by 2.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.DynamicAmplifyDSP.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: 3D sound amplification DSP filter that works on 2 channels only. The difference between left and right channel is calculated and added to the main signal.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.GStreamer.DSP.Sound3DDSP.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the 3D Amplification Value. A Value of 1000 is the same as disabling the Filter. Values less than 1000 is the same as doing a DownMix (Mono) of the 2 Channels. Values higher then 10000 will distort the Sound.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopier`2
member.summary: Static class to efficiently store the compiled delegate which can do the copying. We need a bit of work to ensure that exceptions are appropriately propagated, as the exception is generated at type initialization time, but we wish it to be thrown as an ArgumentException. Note that this type we do not have a constructor constraint on TTarget, because we only use the constructor when we use the form which creates a new instance.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopier`2.creator
member.summary: Delegate to create a new instance of the target type given an instance of the source type. This is a single delegate from an expression tree.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopier`2.sourceProperties
member.summary: List of properties to grab values from. The corresponding targetProperties list contains the same properties in the target type. Unfortunately we can't use expression trees to do this, because we basically need a sequence of statements. We could build a DynamicMethod, but that's significantly more work :) Please mail me if you really need this...

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopy
member.summary: Non-generic class allowing properties to be copied from one instance to another existing instance of a potentially different type.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopy.Copy``2(``0,``1)
member.summary: Copies all public, readable properties from the source object to the target. The target type does not have to have a parameterless constructor, as no new instance needs to be created.
member.remarks: Only the properties of the source and target types themselves are taken into account, regardless of the actual types of the arguments.

member.name: T:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopy`1
member.summary: Generic class which copies to its target type from a source type specified in the Copy method. The types are specified separately to take advantage of type inference on generic method arguments.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.Helpers.JsonPropertyCopy`1.CopyFrom``1(``0)
member.summary: Copies all readable properties from the source to a new instance of TTarget.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.TagTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag types contained in the current instance.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.remarks: The title is most commonly the name of the song or episode or a movie title. For example, "Daydream Believer" (a song by the Monkies), "Space Seed" (an episode of Star Trek), or "Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle" (a movie).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Performers
member.summary: Gets or sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is most commonly called "Artists" in media applications and should be used to represent each of the artists appearing in the media. It can be simple in theform of "The Beatles", or more complicated in the form of "John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison, Pete Best", depending on the preferences of the listener and the degree to which they organize their media collection.
As the preference of the user may vary, applications should not try to limit the user in what choice they may make.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.AlbumArtists
member.summary: Gets or sets the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field is typically optional but aids in the sorting of compilations or albums with multiple artists. For example, if an album has several artists, sorting by artist will split up the album and sorting by album will split up albums by the same artist. Having a single album artist for an entire album will solve this problem.

As this value is to be used as a sorting key, it should be used with less variation than . Where performers can be broken into muliple artist it is best to stick with a single band name. For example, "The Beatles".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Composers
member.summary: Gets or sets the composers of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the composers of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the composers, song writers, script writers, or persons who claim authorship of the media.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Album
member.summary: Gets or sets the album of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the album of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the name of the album the media belongs to. In the case of a boxed set, it should be the name of the entire set rather than the individual disc.
For example, "Rubber Soul" (an album by the Beatles), "The Sopranos: Complete First Season" (a boxed set of TV episodes), or "Back To The Future Trilogy" (a boxed set of movies).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field should be used to store user notes and comments. There is no constraint on what text can be stored here, but it should not contain program information.

Because this field contains notes that the user might think of while listening to the media, it may be useful for an application to make this field easily accessible, perhaps even including it in the main interface.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Genres
member.summary: Gets or sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Year
member.summary: Gets or sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.

remarks.para: Years greater than 9999 cannot be stored by most tagging formats and will be cleared if a higher value is set.
Some tagging formats store higher precision dates which will be truncated when this property is set. Format specific implementations are necessary access the higher precision values.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Track
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album.
member.value: A containing the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: This value should be the same as is listed on the album cover and no more than if is non-zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.TrackCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of tracks in the album containing the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of tracks in the album containing the media represented by the current instance or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: If non-zero, this value should be at least equal to . If is zero, this value should also be zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Disc
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of the disc containing the media represented by the current instance in the boxed set.
member.value: A containing the number of the disc containing the media represented by the current instance in the boxed set.

remarks.para: This value should be the same as is number that appears on the disc. For example, if the disc is the first of three, the value should be 1. It should be no more than if is non-zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.DiscCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of discs in the boxed set containing the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of discs in the boxed set containing the media represented by the current instance or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: If non-zero, this value should be at least equal to . If is zero, this value should also be zero.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Lyrics
member.summary: Gets or sets the lyrics or script of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the lyrics or script of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field contains a plain text representation of the lyrics or scripts with line breaks and whitespace being the only formatting marks.
Some formats support more advances lyrics, like synchronized lyrics, but those must be accessed using format specific implementations.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Grouping
member.summary: Gets or sets the grouping on the album which the media in the current instance belongs to.
member.value: A object containing the grouping on the album which the media in the current instance belongs to or if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field contains a non-physical grouping to which the track belongs. In classical music, this could be a movement. It could also be parts of a series like "Introduction", "Closing Remarks", etc.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.BeatsPerMinute
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of beats per minute in the audio of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the number of beats per minute in the audio of the media represented by the current instance, or zero if not specified.

remarks.para: This field is useful for DJ's who are trying to match songs. It should be calculated from the audio or pulled from a database.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Conductor
member.summary: Gets or sets the conductor or director of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the conductor or director of the media represented by the current instance or if no value present.

remarks.para: This field is most useful for organizing classical music and movies.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.Copyright
member.summary: Gets or sets the copyright information for the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the copyright information for the media represented by the current instance or if no value present.

remarks.para: This field should be used for storing copyright information. It may be useful to show this information somewhere in the program while the media is playing.
Players should not support editing this field, but media creation tools should definitely allow modification.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_ArtistId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Artist ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ArtistID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ArtistID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Artist of the track.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_ReleaseId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Release ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Release to which this track belongs.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_ReleaseArtistId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Release Artist ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseArtistID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz Release ArtistID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular Album Artist credited with the Album.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_TrackId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Track ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz TrackID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz TrackID, and is used to uniquely identify a particular track.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_DiscId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Disc ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz DiscID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz DiscID, and is used to uniquely identify the particular Released Media associated with this track.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicIpId
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicIP PUID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicIP PUID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicIP PUID, and is an acoustic fingerprint identifier. It Identifies what this track "Sounds Like".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.AmazonId
member.summary: Gets or sets the Amazon ID of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the AmazonID of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the AmazonID, and is used to identify the particular track or album in the Amazon Catalog.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_ReleaseStatus
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Release Status of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseStatus of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseStatus, and is used to describes how 'official' a Release is. Common Status are: Official, Promotion, Bootleg, Pseudo-release.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_ReleaseType
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Release Type of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseType of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseType, that describes what kind of release a Release is.. Common Status are: Single, Album, EP, Compilation, Soundtrack, SpokenWord, Interview, Audiobook, Live, Remix, and Other. Careful thought must be given when using this field to decide if a particular track "Is a Compilation".

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.MediaFileTags.MusicBrainz_ReleaseCountry
member.summary: Gets or sets the MusicBrainz Release Country of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field represents the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry, that describes the country in which an album was released. Note that the ReleaseCountry of an album is not necessarily the country in which it was produced. The label itself will typically be more relevant. eg, a release on "Foo Records UK" that has "Made in Austria" printed on it, will likely be a UK release.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.AudioEncoders.VorbisEncoderSettings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets or sets the bitrate. Attempt to encode at a bitrate averaging this (in bps). This uses the bitrate management engine, and is not recommended for most users. Quality is a better alternative. (-1 = disabled). Range is [16..240].

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum bitrate(in bps). Useful for encoding for a fixed-size channel. (-1 = disabled). Range is [16..240].

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Decklink.DecklinkAudioSinkInfo.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns:
A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning
Less than zero This instance precedes in the sort order.
Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as .
Greater than zero This instance follows in the sort order.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Output.AudioOutputDeviceInfo.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns:
A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning
Less than zero This instance precedes in the sort order.
Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as .
Greater than zero This instance follows in the sort order.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Indexed
member.summary: The pixel data contains color-indexed values, which means the values are an index to colors in the system color table, as opposed to individual color values.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Gdi
member.summary: The pixel data contains GDI colors.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Alpha
member.summary: The pixel data contains alpha values that are not premultiplied.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.PAlpha
member.summary: The pixel format contains premultiplied alpha values.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Canonical
member.summary: The default pixel format of 32 bits per pixel. The format specifies 24-bit color depth and an 8-bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format1bppIndexed
member.summary: Specifies that the pixel format is 1 bit per pixel and that it uses indexed color. The color table therefore has two colors in it.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format4bppIndexed
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 4 bits per pixel, indexed.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format8bppIndexed
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 8 bits per pixel, indexed. The color table therefore has 256 colors in it.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format16bppGrayScale
member.summary: The pixel format is 16 bits per pixel. The color information specifies 65536 shades of gray.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format16bppRgb555
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components. The remaining bit is not used.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format16bppRgb565
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 16 bits per pixel; 5 bits are used for the red component, 6 bits are used for the green component, and 5 bits are used for the blue component.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format16bppArgb1555
member.summary: The pixel format is 16 bits per pixel. The color information specifies 32,768 shades of color, of which 5 bits are red, 5 bits are green, 5 bits are blue, and 1 bit is alpha.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format24bppRgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 24 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format32bppRgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components. The remaining 8 bits are not used.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format32bppArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format32bppPArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 32 bits per pixel; 8 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components. The red, green, and blue components are premultiplied, according to the alpha component.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format48bppRgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 48 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format64bppArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Format64bppPArgb
member.summary: Specifies that the format is 64 bits per pixel; 16 bits each are used for the alpha, red, green, and blue components. The red, green, and blue components are premultiplied according to the alpha component.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.PixelFormatX.Max
member.summary: The maximum value for this enumeration.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.ASFSinkSettings.MergeStreamTags
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the stream metadata (received as events in the sink) should be merged to the main file metadata.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.ASFSinkSettings.PacketSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the ASF packets.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.ASFSinkSettings.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding size of the padding object to be added to the end of the header. If this less than 24 (the smaller size of an ASF object), no padding is added.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.ASFSinkSettings.Preroll
member.summary: Gets or sets the preroll time.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.ASFSinkSettings.Streamable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether ASF file is streamable. If set to true, the output should be as if it is to be streamed and hence no indexes written or duration written.

member.summary: Gets or sets an offset to add to all clusters/blocks (in nanoseconds).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.CreationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation time. This will be used for the DateUTC field. Null means that the current time will be used.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.MaxClusterDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum duration of the cluster. A new cluster will be created if its duration exceeds this value. 0 means no maximum duration.
member.value: The maximum duration of the cluster.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.MinClusterDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum duration of the cluster. A new cluster will be created irrespective of this property if a force key unit event is received. 0 means create a new cluster for each video keyframe or for each audio buffer in audio only streams.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.MinIndexInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum index interval. An index entry is created every so many nanoseconds.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.OffsetToZero
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether offsets all streams so that the earliest stream starts at 0.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.Streamable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the output file is streamable. If set to true, the output should be as if it is to be streamed and hence no indexes written or duration written.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.Timecodescale
member.summary: Gets or sets the timecode scale value, used to calculate the Raw Timecode of a Block.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version. This parameter determines what Matroska features can be used.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MKVSinkSettings.WritingApp

member.summary: Gets or sets the filename (or pattern like "file%02d.mp4" if the split mode used).

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether fast start enabled.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.ForceChunks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether force multiple chunks to be created even for single-stream files.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.ForceCreateTimecodeTrak
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether create a timecode trak even in unsupported flavors.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.FragmentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the fragment durations (produce a fragmented file if > 0).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.FragmentMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the influence how fragmented files are produces. Only has any affect when the the 'FragmentDuration' property is set to a value greater than '0'.
member.remarks: Currently, two options exist: "dash-or-mss": for the original fragmented mode that supports dash or mocrosoft smoothstreaming with a single input stream "first-moov-then-finalise" is a fragmented mode that will start with a self-contained 'moov' atom fo the first fragment, then produce fragments.When the file is finalised, the initial 'moov' is invalidated and a new 'moov' is written covering the entire file.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.InterleaveBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the interleave between streams in bytes.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.InterleaveTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the interleave between streams in nanoseconds.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.MaxRAWAudioDrift
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed drift of raw audio samples vs.timestamps in nanoseconds.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.Sinks.MP4SinkSettings.MOOVRecoveryFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file to be used to store data for moov atom making movie file recovery possible in case of a crash during muxing. Null for disabled. (Experimental).

member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplier for converting reserved-max-duration into bytes of header to reserve, per second, per track.

member.summary: Gets or sets the reports the approximate amount of remaining moov header space reserved using reserved-max-duration.

member.summary: Gets or sets the when set to a value > 0, reserves space for index tables at the beginning of the file..

member.summary: Gets or sets the Adaptive Quantization Strength when spatial-aq is enabled from 1 (low) to 15 (aggressive), (0 = autoselect).

member.summary: Gets or sets the bitrate (kbit/s) (0 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the target constant quality level for VBR mode (0 = automatic).

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frames between intra frames (-1 = infinite).

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether adaptive I-frame insert when lookahead is enabled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum bitrate (Kbit/s). Ignored for CBR mode.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic insertion of non-reference P-frames is enabled.

member.summary: Gets or sets the constant quantizer (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the constant QP value for B frame, When >= 0, "QPConstI" and "QPConstP" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPConst" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the constant QP value for I frame, When >= 0, "QPConstP" and "QPConstB" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPConst" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the constant QP value for P frame, When >= 0, "QPConstI" and "QPConstB" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPConst" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum quantizer (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the Maximum QP value for B frame, When >= 0, "QPMaxI" and "QPMaxP" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPMax" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEncoders.NVENCBaseEncoderSettings.QPMaxI
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum QP value for I frame, When >= 0, "QPMaxP" and "QPMaxB" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPMax" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEncoders.NVENCBaseEncoderSettings.QPMaxP
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum QP value for P frame, When >= 0, "QPMaxI" and "QPMaxB" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPMax" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum quantizer (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum QP value for B frame, When >= 0, "QPMinI" and "QPMinP" should be also >= 0. Overwritten by "QPMin" (-1 = from NVENC preset).

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Bulge
member.summary: Bugle adds a protuberance in the center point.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Circle
member.summary: Circle warps the picture into an arc shaped form.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Diffuse
member.summary: Diffuse effect diffuses the image by moving its pixels in random directions.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Kaleidoscope
member.summary: The kaleidscope element applies 'kaleidoscope' geometric transform to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Marble
member.summary: The marble effect applies a marbling effect to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Mirror
member.summary: The mirror effect splits the image into two halves and reflects one over each other.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Perspective
member.summary: The perspective effect applies a perspective transform to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Pinch
member.summary: The pinch effect applies a pinch transform to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Smooth
member.summary: The pinch effect applies a smooth effect to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Rotate
member.summary: The rotate effect applies a rotation transform to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Sphere
member.summary: The sphere effect applies a sphere transform to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Square
member.summary: The square effect distorts the center part of the image into a square.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Stretch
member.summary: The stretch effect stretches the image in a circle around the center point.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Tunnel
member.summary: The tunnel effect is a geometric image transform. It applies a light tunnel effect.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Twirl
member.summary: The twirl effect twists the image from the center out.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.WaterRipple
member.summary: The water ripple effect applies a water ripple effect to the image.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Aging
member.summary: Aging video effect ages a video stream, adds scratches, dust, and change colors.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Dice
member.summary: The effect dices the screen up into many small squares. Each square is rotated randomly in one of four directions: 0, 90, 180 or 270 degrees.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Edge
member.summary: Edge detects edges and display it using low resolution.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.OpticalAnimationBW
member.summary: Black and white optical animation effect.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.MovingBlur
member.summary: Moving blur effect detects a difference from the previous frame and blurs it.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.MovingEcho
member.summary: Moving echo effect makes echo images of moving objects.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.MovingZoomEcho
member.summary: Moving-zoom echo effect makes echo images with scaling, rotating and moving.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.Types.X.VideoEffects.VideoEffectID.Ripple
member.summary: The ripple effect does ripple mark effect on the video input.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.CanRead
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.value: true if this instance can read; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.CanSeek
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.
member.value: true if this instance can seek; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.CanWrite
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.
member.value: true if this instance can write; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Length
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the length in bytes of the stream.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Position
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the position within the current stream.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.VideoEncryption.DecryptorStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
